bug.short_desc: Inaccuracies in Resolved Issues for Seam in 5.2.0

long_desc.thetext:
Document URL: http://documentation-devel.engineering.redhat.com/docs/en-US/JBoss_Enterprise_Application_Platform/5/html/Release_Notes_5.2.0/ch04.html
Section Number and Name: Seam/Seam2, https://issues.jboss.org/browse/JBPAPP-8322
Describe the issue: The formulation is not right towards the end: "...lookup from user applications and Seamspace examples..." The Seamspace example is not mentioned in the issue at all, the issue pertained to multiple examples: mail, quartz, seambay and seampay (as stated in one of the comments).
Suggestions for improvement: The text should either list the affected examples or just say "...lookup from user applications and Seam examples..."
Additional information:

Several other issues found in the same document, in the same section (Resolved Issues for Seam):
JBPAPP-7183: The sentence "This update ensures that when an empty path is detected, "/" is set as the cookie value." is incorrect, it should state "..."/" is set as the cookie path".
JBPAPP-8465: The RN text contains the text "cgilib.jar" (with an extra "i" as the third character). Correct is "cglib.jar".
JBPAPP-8376: The RN text for this issue seems superfluous, because the failure of the Seambay ftest happened only because of JBPAPP-10075. So, the RN text currently describes JBPAPP-10075. Also, it is inconsistent in this sentence: "When a SOAP message did not contain the element and was processed by the SOAPRequestHandler, the processing failed with a NotLoggedInException." The NotLoggedInException is not related to the SOAPRequestHandler itself, it is just a result of the broken SOAPRequestHandler, specific to the Seambay example. I think this RN should only briefly state that the Seambay now works, because JBPAPP-10075 was fixed. JBPAPP-10075 has a RN in the same section anyway.
JBPAPP-10075: It would be clearer if the phrase "..so attempts by the Seam web service to process..." used an indefinite article: "..so attempts by a Seam web service to process...".
JBPAPP-7201: The first sentence is unclear in saying "...interfaces in the Seam Component were...". It should say something like "...interfaces of a Seam component...". Also, the sentence "This data structure does not guarantee the order of local and remote business interfaces, which resulted in the order being undeterministic." is a bit clumsy. There's no relation between HashSets and business interfaces, so something like "This data structure does not guarantee the order of elements, thus the order of business interfaces was nondeterministic." would sound clearer. Finally, the correct class is java.util.LinkedHashSet, not java.util.LinkHashSet.

Attention: Ron
Regarding JBPAPP-7183, please confirm what the cookie's value is set to if an empty path is detected. I'm a little confused when you have written:
"..."/"
Please also review the JIRA comments for this issue. Marek Novotny suggests a significant change to the Release Notes' text.

Attention: Ron
Regarding JBPAPP-8376, could you please review the latest 2 comments by Marek Novotny on this issue? Those comments seem to conflict with what you stated in comment 1 above. I am not able to confirm which is the more technically accurate and from that determine what the issue's Release Notes text should be.

Status quo:
JBPAPP-8322 - COMPLETE Text changed to "...lookup from user applications and Seam examples..." as per Ron's advice in this ticket's description.
JBPAPP-7183 - NEEDINFO Waiting on feedback from Ron, as per comment 2 above.
JBPAPP-8465 - COMPLETE I looked at the latest revision of the document on docstage and couldn't confirm this issue. It may have been corrected in the meantime.
JBPAPP-8376 - NEEDINFO Waiting on feedback from Ron, as per comment 3 above.
JBPAPP-10075 - COMPLETE Text changed as per Ron's excellent feedback.
JBPAPP-7201 - COMPLETE Text changed as per Ron's excellent feedback.

Re: JBPAPP-7183 There's a bit of a mix up between issues JBPAPP-7183 and JBPAPP-7269. They are both related to bugs in <s:token> (even in the same class ClientUidSelector), but JBPAPP-7183 talks about an issue with the cookie _path_ being empty and JBPAPP-7269 deals with illegal characters in the cookie _value_. However, changesets for both of these issues are mistakenly referring to JBPAPP-7183. That's also the reason for Marek's RN text proposal being so different -- it refers to JBPAPP-7269. I think the RN text for JBPAPP-7183 is OK, if we just fix the problem with the forward slash -- currently it says, paraphrasing: "If the cookie *path* is empty, the cookie *value* is set to forward slash" Correct would be: "If the cookie *path* is empty, the cookie *path* is set to forward slash" What I missed, however, is that the JBPAPP-7269 is missing in the Release Notes Resolved Issues. Even though these issues are related to the same class, they still fix different problems and thus should be mentioned separately, I think.
Re: JBPAPP-8465 If I check http://documentation-devel.engineering.redhat.com/docs/en-US/JBoss_Enterprise_Application_Platform/5/html/Release_Notes_5.2.0/ch04.html doing a complete refresh (bypassing cache, seeing the other changes you made) I still see "cgilib.jar". Just to make sure we understand each other: It is a Code Generation Library, so just CG Lib -- cglib.jar (just one "i" in the word).
Re: JBPAPP-8376 The problem here is that these 2 issues: JBPAPP-8376 and JBPAPP-10075 describe the same underlying problem, even the RN texts of both describe the exact same problem: the SOAPRequestHandler didn't add the header to a message that did not contain it and thus processing of a message failed. Now the header is added. My suggestion was to make JBPAPP-8376 RN text state only that it happened due to the underlying issue JBPAPP-10075, which was fixed. I do not find so important the fact that the whole discussion about the underlying problem (JBPAPP-10075) happened in JBPAPP-8376. I reviewed Marek's comments and to make this clear, I'll rephrase the points I tried to make in my first comment: 1. The RN text is superfluous (but still valid), because it describes something that is already described elsewhere (the RN text for JBPAPP-10075) 2. I found the RN text a little confusing, because it made it sound as if the SOAPRequestHandler raised the NotLoggedInException. I find the RN proposal by Marek Novotny in his last comment in JBPAPP-8376 correct, he especially tries to remove this confusion (emphasis mine): "...processing may fail with a Exception, IN CASE OF SEAMBAY example with a NotLoggedInException...".

I've been reminded there's another problem with several of these issues, specifically JBPAPP-8465, JBPAPP-8376, JBPAPP-10075 and partly JBPAPP-8322. These are all related to the forward compatibility of Seam2 with EAP6, but this is not mentioned in these release notes.
JBPAPP-8322: This RN already contains a mention of EAP6 in the first sentence, which is OK. However, the last sentence mistakenly mentions EAP5. The last sentence should say (change marked with *): "The respective transaction lookup was added to EAP 5 Seam so that transaction lookup from user applications and Seam examples now works as expected *also on EAP 6*. "
JBPAPP-8376: Again, we need to mention that the described behaviour pertains only to EAP6 and not to EAP5. Assuming we agree that this issue should only refer to the underlying JBPAPP-10075, as described in previous comments, the RN text should say something like: "The Seambay example failed the functional tests on EAP 6, throwing a NotLoggedInException. This was caused by the underlying issue JBPAPP-10075, which was fixed in this release."
JBPAPP-10075: Add mention of EAP6 plus fix a mistake (remove the word "function" after "SOAPRequestHandler"): "The Seam web service integration uses the SOAP header for storing the conversation's ID. However the SOAP header is not mandatory *and in EAP 6 it's no longer present by default*. Therefore any attempts by a Seam web service to process a message without a header failed. To resolve this issue the SOAPRequestHandler now adds a header to any message where the header is missing."
JBPAPP-8465: Mention of EAP6: "The Spring example application failed to run *on EAP 6* because the *cglib.jar* file was signed. This has now been resolved by un-signing the file and the example now runs *also on EAP 6*."

JBPAPP-8322 I changed the last sentence to read: "The respective transaction lookup was added to JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 5 Seam so that transaction lookup from user applications and the Seam examples now works as expected also on JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 5 and 6."
Is this revision correct?
JBPAPP-8465 I changed "cgilib.jar" to "clib.jar". I also changed the product references as so: "The Spring example application failed to run on JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 6 because the <filename>cglib.jar</filename> file was signed. This has now been resolved by un-signing the file and the example now runs on JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 5 and 6."
JBPAPP-10075 I have made the changes proposed above (in Comment 6).
JBPAPP-8376 I have replaced the existing text with the text proposed above (in Comment 6).
JBPAPP-7269 I have now added a Release Notes entry for this JIRA issue, in the "Seam/Seam 2" section.

I have made all the requested changes. The amended revision is available at [1]. When validating this change, please confirm that you're viewing revision 25 or higher.
http://documentation-devel.engineering.redhat.com/docs/en-US/JBoss_Enterprise_Application_Platform/5/html-single/Release_Notes_5.2.0/index.html

It's almost correct now, just a few more notes:
JBPAPP-8322: Basically OK, but it would be even clearer, if the wording was as proposed. Your reformulation says: "... works as expected also on JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 5 and 6.", which makes it sound as if it had never worked before neither on EAP5 nor EAP6. That's not true. This has not been an issue with EAP5, it worked OK there. It has only now been ammended (not really "fixed") in Seam2 (which is distributed as part of EAP5 and certified to work with EAP6) so as to work also with EAP6. So I propose again, either: "...now works as expected _on both_ JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 5 and 6." or the original wording "...now works as expected also on JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 6."
JBPAPP-7269: The description of the fix given in the last sentence is wrong. Using decodeHex and encodeHex methods was only suggested by some user in the JBSEAM-4503 issue, but it has not been accepted. The changeset is here: https://source.jboss.org/browse/Seam/branches/enterprise/JBPAPP_5_0/ui/src/main/java/org/jboss/seam/ui/ClientUidSelector.java?u=3&r1=11218&r2=14292 By looking at org.jboss.seam.util.RandomStringUtils, it can be seen that -- and this should be the last sentence of the RN text -- the issue is fixed by only allowing letters and numbers to be a part of the cookie value. Sorry for not mentioning this information earlier.
JBPAPP-10075: I insist on including one important part you seem to have dropped -- the emphasis that the SOAP Header is no longer present *only in EAP6*. Again, this issue has surfaced only due to the migration effort of EAP5's Seam2 to EAP6. So due to some changes (the lack of SOAP header by default) in behaviour of EAP6 (most likely the JAX-WS implementation), this became an issue for Seam2 applications running on EAP6. Therefore, I suggest reverting the sentence "However the SOAP header is not mandatory and no longer present by default." to "However the SOAP header is not mandatory and in EAP 6 it's no longer present by default" or some *grammatically or stylistically* more appropriate form thereof.

Attention: Ron
The EAP 5.2.0 GA date is today so I can't make any further changes as yet. However I will make this amendement and have a corrected revision of the Release Notes made available within the next working day or so.
I have therefore changed this ticket's status to 'Assigned' as it's now my responsibility.

Attention: Ron
Another issue requires me to change and re-release the EAP 5.2.0 Release Notes so I will correct these issues immediately. I'll update this ticket again when the amended revision is available.

I have made all the requested changes. The amended revision is available at [1]. When validating this change, please confirm that you're viewing revision 101 or higher.
http://documentation-devel.engineering.redhat.com/docs/en-US/JBoss_Enterprise_Application_Platform/5/html-single/Release_Notes_5.2.0/index.html
Ron: Can I please check something. Regarding JBPAPP-7269 you said "the issue is fixed by only allowing letters and numbers to be a part of the cookie value". However when I look at the code you linked to, the function in use is named "randomAscii". If it's randomly selecting ASCII characters, couldn't it still select a semicolon (as an example only) and therefore still create a cookie with an invalid value?

JBPAPP-7269: In the linked changeset red lines are removed, green lines added. So the call changed from randomAscii(50) to random(50, true, true). I verified the correct behaviour in a one-off covering this issue a few weeks ago, it is definitely OK: https://issues.jboss.org/browse/JBPAPP-10456?focusedCommentId=12740080&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-12740080
JBPAPP-10075: Just a typo: "JBoss Enterprise PLatform 6" (missing "Application", capital L in "Platform")

bug.short_desc: Problems with testing of DeltaSpike quickstarts

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: There are multiple issues with testing of DeltaSpike quickstarts.
1. example-settings.xml and README Described in https://issues.jboss.org/browse/JDF-206. Also, in the WFK quickstarts README: - Section "Configure Maven" (EAP6), point 1: the formulation "unzip every Maven repository zip file into a directory of your choice." is quite unclear. If it's supposed to mean, that all of the repositories (EAP, WFK) should be unpacked into one directory (effectively merging the repositories), it should say something like "unzip the Maven repository zip files into one directory" - changes may need to be made to the mirroring settings in settings-wfk-example.xml, if the jboss public repository would be included.
2. MavenDependencyResolver https://issues.jboss.org/browse/JDF-207 Taking into account the changes above (adding repo http://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/public, changing mirroring to "*,!central-eap6,!central-eap6-plugins,!jboss-public-repository-group"), tests for quickstarts that use MavenDependencyResolver (at least deltaspike-beanbuilder, deltaspike-deactivatable, cdi-add-interceptor-binding) still don't work. Even though they build OK, the MavenDependencyResolver can't get DeltaSpike dependencies, which implies, that it can't access central (which might be a problem of MavenDependencyResolver itself).
3. deltaspike-deactivatable This quickstart depends on 1.0.3.Final version of the JBoss BOMs, which is mosty likely incorrect, as all the other distributed quickstarts depend on 1.0.4.Final-redhat-1.
4. deltaspike-helloworld-jms This quickstart depends on Weld SE, which is not a supported technology in WFK.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 2.2.0-DR1
